channel.title: Question on anonymity - Multiple isolated workstations attached to same gateway
channel.description: Patrick, what is the effect on anonymity if one was to attack two workstations via 2 different internal networks/ internal facing NICs on the same Whonix Gateway?

item.title: Question on anonymity - Multiple isolated workstations attached to same gateway
item.dc:creator: HulaHoop
item.description:
The answer was in your excellent wiki all along!

Multiple Whonix-Workstations (using different internal IP's) are automatically separated by Tor (IsolateClientAddr is Tor's default).

Read full topic
item.source: Question on anonymity - Multiple isolated workstations attached to same gateway

item.title: Question on anonymity - Multiple isolated workstations attached to same gateway
item.dc:creator: HulaHoop
item.description:
Very helpful links thanks.

One more question: Would anonymized traffic coming from an exit note indicate that the output of both machine (on their separate and secure virtual networks) is coming from the same entity?

Read full topic
item.source: Question on anonymity - Multiple isolated workstations attached to same gateway

item.title: Question on anonymity - Multiple isolated workstations attached to same gateway
item.dc:creator: Patrick
item.description:
Which machine is the compromised one, which one is the attacker?

Maybe this is related.

  • https://www.whonix.org/wiki/Multiple_Whonix-Workstations
  • https://www.whonix.org/wiki/Connections_between_Whonix-Gateway_and_Whonix-Workstation

Please tell me any further questions!

Read full topic
